title: Hawaiian earring
summary: In mathematics, the Hawaiian earring H {\displaystyle \mathbb {H} } is the topological space defined by the union of circles in the Euclidean plane R 2 {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{2}} with center ( 1 n , 0 ) {\displaystyle \left({\tfrac {1}{n}},0\right)} and radius 1 n {\displaystyle {\tfrac {1}{n}}} for n = 1 , 2 , 3 , â€¦ {\displaystyle n=1,2,3,\ldots } endowed with the subspace topology:
